paper.title: The CHC Adaptive Search Algorithm: How to Have Safe Search When Engaging in Nontraditional Genetic Recombination

author.org: Philips Laboratories, North American Philips Corporation, 345 Scarborough Road, Briarcliff Manor, New York 10510

paper.abstract: Abstract This paper describes and analyzes CHC, a nontraditional genetic algorithm which combines a conservative selection strategy that always preserves the best individuals found so far with a radical (highly disruptive) recombination operator that produces offspring that are maximally different from both parents. The traditional reasons for preferring a recombination operator with a low probability of disrupting schemata may not hold when such a conservative selection strategy is used. On the contrary, certain highly disruptive crossover operators provide more effective search. Empirical evidence is provided to support these claims.
